heisig_chinese_memo: A diamond is as sparkling as three suns.
heisig_story: What else can the word sparkle suggest if not a diamond? And if you've ever held a diamond up to the light, you will have noticed how every facet of it becomes like a miniature sun. This kanji is a picture of a tiny sun in three places (that is, "everywhere"), to give the sense of something that sparkles on all sides. Just like a diamond. In writing the primitive elements three times, note again how the rule for writing given in frame 4 holds true not only for the strokes in each individual element but also for the disposition of the elements in the character as a whole.
koohiiStory1: A diamond sparkles as brightly as three suns.
koohiiStory2: Sparkle is a forest (#197) of suns!
jp_example_words: 結晶(けっしょう): crystal, crystallization
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The sun hits this and breaks into three suns. What can split the sun in three directions? A crystal!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Crystals take light and refract it around into many directions. That's why there are three suns in this kanji.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Who is hoarding and harnessing the power of these crystals? That would be the Shougun (しょう).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine the Shougun laying in his bed of crystals. He still has his really serious, angry face though. Even as he rubs the crystals to his face, he's glowering.
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 昌 (さかん、ショウ процветающий).

Ru_trainchinese: jīng: (графема) сверкающий, искрящийся; кварц, горный хрусталь; кристалл, кристаллическое вещество
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if three suns (日) are shining everything should be crystal clear
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A diamond is as sparkling as three suns.
origin_of_ch_char_book: For ancient East Asian people, nature was to be revered. When they gazed upon the clear night skies and many stars above, they thought that the stars were like spirits of people. (星, xing=hsing star) When we see this character, it shows the green plants (屮) coming up from the earth (土), which symbolizes full of life (生, sheng, to live, life), and stars scattered around it (晶, jing, brilliant; crystal). In ancient dictionary, it was explained that “stars are spirits of all living things”. According to the explanations, the stars or the constellations are related to the spirits of living things. Why did the ancient people connect the stars with the spirit?
humanum_full_description_en:
From the three circles (indicated by ◎), like the shape of three stars, the ancient three can represent the majority, so it can be understood as numerous stars. " Crystal " is the first text of " star ". In later generations, " crystal " means the star is bright, sparkling or crystal, so the word " star " is used to express the original meaning of the star. Or add a point in the middle of the circle, and a point until the Warring States text extends into a horizontal painting, which is then mixed with " Japanese ". Oracle is used as the original meaning, "Compilation" 11503: "㞢 (Yes) New Big Crystal (Star) and Fire." It means that the new Big Star is parallel to Mars (Qu Wanli). " Fire " is short for Mars, see " Fire ".

The meaning of brightness and brilliance is derived from the starlight, Volume 2 of "Seven Signs of the Clouds": "There is no sun, no moon, no crystal and no light." From bright extension, " crystal " can mean bright, clean and clear. Cui Rong et al. Dongzheng from Liang Wang (preface)>: "The sky is cloudless, and the breeze clears the sea." Starlight does not emit heat. Therefore, the crystal that shows cold light is called "Crystal" (Shirakawa Jing). "Said Wen": "Crystal, fine light, from three days. Every crystal belongs to the crystal." Duan Yucai's note: "Everything is prosperous, all three words."
humanum_short_description_en: From the three circles (indicated by ◎), it resembles the shape of three stars. In ancient times, three can represent the majority, so it can be understood as numerous stars. " Crystal " is the first text of " star ". In later generations, " crystal " means the star is bright, sparkling or crystal, so the word " star " is used to express the original meaning of the star.
humanum_full_description:
從三個圓圈(以◎表示)，象三顆星星之形，古代三可代表多數，故可理解為眾多星星，「晶」是「星」的初文。後世「晶」表示星光明亮、晶瑩或水晶，故以「星」字表示星星的本義。或在圓圈中間加一點，一點至戰國文字延伸為一橫畫，遂與「日」相混。甲骨文用作本義，《合集》11503：「㞢(有)新大晶(星)並火。」表示新大星與火星並行(屈萬里)。「火」是火星的簡稱，參見「火」。

　　由星光引申出明亮、光亮之義，《雲笈七籤》卷二：「無日無月，無晶無光。」由明亮引申，「晶」可表示明淨、清朗，陳子昂〈送著作佐郎崔融等從梁王東征（并序）〉：「天晶無雲，朔風清海。」星光並不發散熱量，因此，顯出冷澈之光的結晶體稱「水晶」(白川靜)。《說文》：「晶，精光也，从三日。凡晶之屬皆从晶。」段玉裁注：「凡言物之盛，皆三其文。」
humanum_short_description: 從三個圓圈(以◎表示)，象三顆星星之形，古代三可代表多數，故可理解為眾多星星，「晶」是「星」的初文。後世「晶」表示星光明亮、晶瑩或水晶，故以「星」字表示星星的本義。

結晶(けっしょう): crystal, crystallization

從三個圓圈(以◎表示)，象三顆星星之形，古代三可代表多數，故可理解為眾多星星，「 晶 」是「 星 」的初文。後世「 晶 」表示星光明亮、晶瑩或水晶，故以「 星 」字表示星星的本義。或在圓圈中間加一點，一點至戰國文字延伸為一橫畫，遂與「 日 」相混。甲骨文用作本義，《合集》11503：「㞢(有)新大晶(星)並火。」表示新大星與火星並行(屈萬里)。「 火 」是火星的簡稱，參見「 火 」。 由星光引申出明亮、光亮之義，《雲笈七籤》卷二：「無日無月，無晶無光。」由明亮引申，「 晶 」可表示明淨、清朗，陳子昂〈送著作佐郎崔融等從梁王東征（并序）〉：「天晶無雲，朔風清海。」星光並不發散熱量，因此，顯出冷澈之光的結晶體稱「水晶」(白川靜)。《說文》：「晶，精光也，从三日。凡晶之屬皆从晶。」段玉裁注：「凡言物之盛，皆三其文。」
From the three circles (indicated by ◎), like the shape of three stars, the ancient three can represent the majority, so it can be understood as numerous stars. " Crystal" is the first text of " star". In later generations, " crystal" means the star is bright, sparkling or crystal, so the word " star" is used to express the original meaning of the star. Or add a point in the middle of the circle, and a point until the Warring States text extends into a horizontal painting, which is then mixed with " Japanese". Oracle is used as the original meaning, "Compilation" 11503: "㞢 (Yes) New Big Crystal (Star) and Fire." It means that the new Big Star is parallel to Mars (Qu Wanli). " Fire" is short for Mars, see " Fire". The meaning of brightness and brilliance is derived from the starlight, Volume 2 of "Seven Signs of the Clouds": "There is no sun, no moon, no crystal and no light." From bright extension, " crystal" can mean bright, clean and clear. Cui Rong et al. Dongzheng from Liang Wang (preface)>: "The sky is cloudless, and the breeze clears the sea." Starlight does not emit heat. Therefore, the crystal that shows cold light is called "Crystal" (Shirakawa Jing). "Said Wen": "Crystal, fine light, from three days. Every crystal belongs to the crystal." Duan Yucai's note: "Everything is prosperous, all three words."

晶字的基本解释

晶
jīng
〔结晶〕ａ．物质从液态或气态形成晶体；ｂ．喻珍贵的成果，如“这部作品是他多年研究的晶晶”。
形容光亮：晶莹。晶亮。晶明。亮晶晶。

晶字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jīng］
［《廣韻》子盈切，平清，精。］
(1)明亮；光亮。
(2)清明；晴朗。
(3)日，太阳。
(4)水晶的简称。
(5)晶体。
(6)用以比喻果实、成果。
(7)同“精”。参见“晶靈”。

晶字的英文翻译

◎ 晶
brilliant, crystal, glittering

晶字的康熙字典解释

【辰集上】【日字部】　晶； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页497第06
【唐韻】子盈切【集韻】【韻會】咨盈切，?音精。【說文】精光也。从三日。【宋之問詩】八月涼風天氣晶。　又晶晶，光也。【歐陽詹·秋月賦】晶晶盈盈。又【方岳詩】江樹曉晶晶。　【集韻】或作晟。　【通雅】古精、晶通。《易林》陽晶隱伏，卽陽精。【讀書通】水精，卽水晶。

晶字的源字形

晶字的起名意思

：晶字是指物质从液态或气态形成晶体，即水晶；比喻珍贵的成果，形容光亮；如晶莹、晶亮、亮晶晶。

crystal
Basic explanation of words
crystal
jīng
[Crystal] a. The substance forms crystals from the liquid or gaseous state; b. Yu's precious achievements, such as "This work is a crystal of his many years of research."
Describe bright: crystal clear. Jingliang. Jingming. Shining.
crystal
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jīng］
["Guangyun" Zi Ying cut, calm and refined. ]
(1) Bright; bright.
(2) Ching Ming; sunny.
(3) Day, the sun.
(4) Abbreviation for crystal.
(5) Crystals.
(6) It is used as a metaphor for fruits and achievements.
(7) Same as "Jing". See "Sparkling".

brilliant, crystal, glittering

crystal
Name meaning
: The word "crystal" refers to the formation of crystals from liquid or gaseous substances, that is, crystal; it is a metaphor for precious fruits, and it describes light; such as glittering, shining and shining.

Три (представляющие множество) звезд вместе, что означает яркость и ясность.
Форма «ри» - это звезда, а не солнце, вы можете сослаться на ноту «ченг».
В надписи на кости оракула слово «кристалл» заимствовано как «звезда».
В полном тексте нет слова «Пин», но его можно увидеть на бамбуковых полосках Чу во время периода Сражающихся царств.
Продукт
jīng
I сущ.
1) горный хрусталь; стеклярус; хрустальный; стеклярусный
晶球 хрустальный шарик
晶帘 стеклярусный занавес
2) мин. (сокр. вм. 结晶) кристалл; кристальный
3) игра лучей; свет, сияние, сверкание, блеск
寒日昼无晶 зимнее солнце и днём светит скупо
II прил.
сияющий, сверкающий; искрящийся, ослепительный; играющий лучами
风高日晶 ветер свеж и солнце ослепительно
Radicals: 日  (sun)
Meaning Mnemonic
The sun hits this and breaks into three suns. What can split the sun in three directions? A crystal!
Crystals take light and refract it around into many directions. That's why there are three suns in this kanji.
Reading Mnemonic
Who is hoarding and harnessing the power of these crystals? That would be the Shougun (しょう).
Imagine the Shougun laying in his bed of crystals. He still has his really serious, angry face though. Even as he rubs the crystals to his face, he's glowering.
